page.title: 17FOLKLORE WELLS NORFOLK
page.content: Norfolk folklore is strange for it doesn't really exist except in proverbs and customs. PROVERBS A ground sweat cures all disorders - When you're dead you can't suffer illness! He has a Friday look - he is sulky. He lies bare of a suit - he has no money. He will make a tight old man - he's a lazy man. There's a bad sheep in every flock. Never sell your hen on a rainy day. CUSTOMS- Pot days It was the custom in some farmhouses to cook only 3 times a week. An uninvited guest would therefore try to work out which day the pot would be on the stove and would say, "I'll go today for its pot day" hoping for a hot meal.
